name: Nexus-crowd-plugin
tagline: This is a fork from sonatype/nexus-crowd-plugin to support up to date versions of nexus and crowd
body:
### Welcome to Nexus-crowd-plugin.
This fork is to keep an up to date version of the nexus-crowd-plugin. With so many updates both on the nexus and crowd front, it's hard to keep track! And those two awesome products work so well together....

### Usage
1. Add a `nexus` application to Crowd with a `SECRET` secret

1. Create a file called `crowd-plugin.xml` under `sonatype-work/nexus/conf`

`<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<crowdConfiguration>
  <crowdServerUrl>http://[crowdhost]:[crowdport]/crowd/</crowdServerUrl>
  <applicationName>nexus</applicationName>
  <applicationPassword>SECRET</applicationPassword>
</crowdConfiguration>`

1. unzip the bundle under `sonatype-work/nexus/plugin-repository`

1. Start Nexus and use the Administration->Server panel to add `OSS Crowd Authentication Realm` to the list of active realms.

### Plugin Download
[nexus-crowd-plugin-2.0.7-bundle.zip](https://github.com/PatrickRoumanoff/nexus-crowd-plugin/wiki/nexus-crowd-plugin-2.0.7-bundle.zip) is the current release for Nexus 2.x and Crowd 2.x.

### Plan for next iterations
* use a properties file (instead of XML)
* enable a group filter
* provide a configuration UI
* enable Single Sign On (SSO)

### Authors and Contributors
@PatrickRoumanoff and @flopma based on initial work by @justinedelson from @sonatype
